text: today I'm going to use this little guy
to make something spicy and delicious
for dinner using leftover rice it's a
version of Thai fried rice but I'm using
Collard so I don't know if it's
completely classic but to get your
flavor you're gonna need a tablespoon of
minced ginger and as you know already I
like to peel my ginger with the side of
a spoon to remove the least amount of
skin and get around all those little
knobs really well so I use the side of a
thin spoon to do it so I'm mincing this
because I like to have a nice bite of
ginger but you could grate it if you
like something a little bit finer slice
into very thin coins and then slice
those coins cross into little strips and
then slice the strips across in two
minutes this is more than a tablespoon
but I'm gonna use the whole thing
because I'm a gender fanatic two cloves
of garlic approximately you'll need a
tablespoon of garlic as well chili I
already have one that's minced and I'm
keeping the seeds in if you want to you
can remove the seeds Thai chilies are
super spicy one of the spiciest chilies
out there over here I have three
tablespoons of coconut oil which is
gonna add a really nice coconut flavor
to my fried rice it's a little unusual
but I kind of love it so start off by
cooking your aromatics this is a quarter
cup of sliced shallot did that add your

translucent and then you can add your

rice is already cooked already cooled
basically leftover rice I'm using two
and a half cups of leftover white rice
every single time you make rice for

have enough to make fried rice now the
great thing about leftover rice you can
freeze it so if you're not gonna make
fried rice the next day or in the next
few days you can freeze your rice and
then just take it out and make your
fried rice you can add your chili now I
kept the seeds as I said
stir the cold rice won't stick together
as much it'll be less clumpy that way
everything gets coated with the
flavorings really well then you don't
add on end up with a big lump of Rights
now you can add your greens I'm using

just cook them off first before you add

things and then put them back in these
collards have already been blanched too
so this is a great use for leftover

really mean it I'm constantly making

always add more and some lime juice

let's taste mmm it smells fish saucy yup
